question_text: A 19-year-old man is evaluated in the emergency department for acute abdominal and back pain.Peripheral blood smear is shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: The most likely diagnosis is sickle cell disease (Option B), which is characterized by numerous spindle- or crescent-shaped erythrocytes (also known as drepanocytes), demonstrated on the peripheral blood smear (arrow). Additional findings often include target cells and Howell-Jolly bodies (nuclear remnants usually removed by the spleen).
